cervix. The fertilised egg 
cannot develop properly and 
your health may be at serious 
risk if the pregnancy continues. 
The egg has to be removed. 
This can be done through an 
operation or with medicines.
Ectopic pregnancy can be 
caused by damage in the 
fallopian tube, possibly as a 
result of an infection. Previous 
abdominal surgery and 
previous ectopic pregnancy 
can also increase the risk. The 
warning signs start soon after 
a missed period.
